name: 2kings
text: A comment left by 2kings was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, straw, ishuta, divot, symbolsoup, daidai, riotdejaneiro, 7th_shot, RandyJohnson, regrepnsnefpoh, robbingdog, MortisInvictus, slysa, cryabetes, regrepsnefpoh, Direhaggis, abe, Madoushi, greyfield, JoulesIsEnergy, alchemicnirvana, LiquidCruelty, Dallovich)

name: yingkaixing
text: I don't have any idea what you mean.

name: ted0phile
text: Your avatar lends the perfect amount of disdain to this asset.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
are you still sort of stoned?

it lends disdain yet charges no interest

name: venividieffluxi
text: He thinks it's rad when ray inhales heated-up marijuana.

name: wazza
text: 2kings has a crush on Ray getting high pass it on

name: chasanator
text: proceed.

name: wite_rabit
text: The icon of this user was used by me at some point in vain attempt to create a Liger - known for it's skills in magic. It just had to have spikes and this image came up in a Google Image search...

name: niggar
text: Can we get this one as a colored poster too?  Sure, it's not as graphically interesting as the last one, but the dialogue is so much more amazing and yet vague enough to not disturb your entire family.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: That would be great, I don't think many people would buy it considering it would mean hanging The Cure on their wall, but I would get it, I totally would.

name: bestfriend
text: A comment left by bestfriend was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, Crowpaw, Scorpio_nadir, SenseiHollywood, Panserbjorne)

name: rhymesforkids
text: A comment left by rhymesforkids was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, daidai, _cheesekayke, SenseiHollywood, STUART)

name: chaesar
text: I bought the dumbest pair of pants one time while high. So dumb.

name: nbgreene
text: A comment left by nbgreene was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, lamboyster, Sweetlips, Stonecrab, eRiUukFJk, SurelySmack)

name: libelandslander
text: This is the kind of thing where it seems like there is a more complex story than "dude got high and bought some stupid pants." I like that story already.

name: partyfoul
text: except that if you were high you'd DEFINITELY want to get some food.

name: saint
text: in the next panel, Ray points at the driftwood and asks "are you gonna eat that?"

name: mrslickster
text: I think he might also decide to go get food, and then spend twenty minutes trying to conceptualize everything that is needed in one's pockets before entering the real world. Then, he will spend another five minutes checking in the mirror to see how stoned he looks.  After that, he will feel the need to apologize to teodor again for making him wait, and leave the house without his keys or cell phone.

name: onepapertiger
text: I don't understand why this doesn't have more chubbies. mrslickster, you have my vote.

name: dallovich
text: Where the hell did he get that driftwood from, did he blackout the 2 hour trip to the nearest lake?

name: randyjohnson
text: A comment left by randyjohnson was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Contrasoma, Norsef, Overmedicated, cmjhogan, mortshire, cryabetes, DigDugz, Huber, blarghamagarky)

name: mangaknightz
text: this will become my default gift for cure fans

name: idiot_circus
text: and they all will immediately understand you, just like teodor

name: ohnoes
text: A comment left by ohnoes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by cryabetes, Mizzip, dj)

name: jamers
text: It floats on emerald waves of time and space, ever seeking that lost, lonely shore some call The Cure.

name: anonymous44
text: *cue melodramatic guitar solo*

name: sp1derbaby
text: *cue trumpet solo and wacky dancing*

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Man, way to make a reference that people who do not listen to the Cure will probably not get, versus one that anyone would get. Way to make a reference that makes complete and utter sense.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Man, way to begin every comment with man

name: soticoto
text: *cue escape to the moon*

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Man, guitar solos are melodramatic by default, this is what they are for

name: grayfox
text: A comment left by grayfox was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by St-Elmos_Fire, Zem, Satyr)

name: isaach
text: A comment left by isaach was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, -0_0-, Audhumla, Huber)

name: sdskyle
text: When I get high alone, I tend to not realize that I'm super-duper stoned. Then I'll go somewhere and just be so completely awkward with people. Also, could Ray's being under the table represent something greater is going on "under the table?" What is Ray hiding?

name: sp1derbaby
text: Ray is hiding himself. From the table. [Under] the table.

name: eviltkat
text: Last I heard, there is no better present for a Cure fan

name: charchar
text: I would like one for the upcoming holiday season but I fail at hinting.

name: sp1derbaby
text: "So... driftwood is pretty awesome, eh? You know what else is awesome? The Cure. Yeah... Say, have you got your Christmas tree yet?"

name: huber
text: I disappointed him - fantastic

name: epicurus
text: Of course teodor doesn't like sports. He listens to The Cure.

name: achilleselbow
text: This is an observation with universal empirical validity, as far as I know.

name: ford
text: you should have said umpirical dogg

name: snatch22
text: Man, he didn't get high alone.  He got high and wandered off.  You guys have never done that?  But man, I love the driftwood thing.  All assuming Teodor knows what he means.  All assuming it's obvious.  As bestfriend said, this totally nails the high experience.

name: darthemed
text: Absolutely. This totally brings back memories of asking for a few sheets of blank paper and a pencil, and then heading off to a separate part of the basement.

name: tekende
text: I wandered away from my friends while high on shrooms. That was...that was a not a good decision.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: And...you have wandered ever since. Do you....do you ever hear from them?

name: tekende
text: My friends? Some of them. They send me messages in bottles, floated across the sea of time.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: That is good friendage.

name: jaminspoon
text: And a very reliable current.

name: broad
text: Aloft on pieces of driftwood that read, "Tom Grasney is   ... SUPER STOKED ABOUT THE FUCKIN' SHOW YOU SHOULD ASK ME ABOUT IT "

name: rosie
text: This is awesome on so many levels. Teodor's mad cuz he was hoping Ray would buy crazy amounts of delicious food. Whipping out the cell and calling Teodor is classic. This strip is so wonderful, especially Teodor's expression as he looks at the driftwood, looks at Ray, and back again. I love that he's still looking at the driftwood in the next day's strip.

name: ford
text: I like to think that a portion of Teodor's mind says, in the smallest voice: " he understands ."

name: jaminspoon
text: A year into the future, I arrive to grant you the third chubby you so richly deserved.

name: sleeps
text: A comment left by sleeps was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by St-Elmos_Fire, cailetshadow, Audhumla, dj)

name: centipede_damascus
text: Even though Ray does not like the Cure, he makes concessions to Teodor's tastes. He is such a good friend.

name: bobquest3
text: I have totally been here

name: nsrdude
text: I agree, it makes total sense at the time.

name: kneejerk
text: as though eternity is something you just FORGET

name: zem
text: hey we could all use reminders in our lives

name: factorial
text: Panel #7, Teodor's expression. Hahaha! Yes, Ray, you disappointed him.

name: czarcastic
text: where did he get the driftwood?

name: sherwood
text: an excellent question.  How in the world did he come by that driftwood?

name: gormster
text: ...drifting?

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: He is Ray. Do not question his driftwood.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Driftwood is merely a giant splinter. As high as Ray is, it's only a matter of proportion. You people talk about being high as if you knew. Pfah!
As if YOU KNEW!

name: firesign
text: He gets stoned a lot of the time, and spends a lot of his time on eBay. Based on the natural overlap in these time frames, his bankroll, and the size of his house, I think that Ray pretty much owns one of everything.

name: angekfire
text: He probably tore it off the table.

name: senseihollywood
text: A comment left by senseihollywood was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, _cheesekayke, milkpants, ssink, Audhumla)

name: senseihollywood
text: A comment left by senseihollywood was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, milkpants, mangaknightz, St-Elmos_Fire, wehavemagnums)

name: sp1derbaby
text: Boo to that.

name: spinynorman
text: A comment left by spinynorman was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, madnes, NeoNaoNeo, sirptom, snatch22, DigDugz, godfatherofsouls, the_dingle, Daniel, Direhaggis, dj)

name: daverud
text: There are no sad eyebrows because he is not sad.  He's kind of fascinated.

name: woodenteeth
text: Wow. Why does this have so many lames? It was funny, and kinda relevantly non-sequitur-ish. Actually it's one of my more favourite spiny comments. ANSWER ME INTERNET!

name: spinynorman
text: I think that was like the second comment I ever made.

name: woodenteeth
text: You... you're the INTERNET?! Now that explains things. Wait. No, it doesn't. People have acquired a taste for you now. Chubbies all falling out of your pockets as you walk down the street.

name: spinynorman
text: Yeah, it's kind of ridiculous. I ain't too sure how I feel about that. Half of me wants to just make a new profile to see if it'd get half as chubbed.

name: woodenteeth
text: Hah. You know the answer to that. You got the storytelling gift and good writer's craft. Popular appeal AND you're a drunk! Write a book about dragons and you'll be a millionaire.

name: layzerblade
text: The Fry avicon also helps a lot. Not that your stuff isn't intrinsically good, but that image would make gladi8orrex's posts seem witty.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Yes, and just think- that comment is so rare it will be a collectible soon. And you have a copy.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: I wish I could lame this

name: leggotheego
text: What a great gift idea

name: bluejay
text: A comment left by bluejay was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rowboat, Paco, Matt, DigDugz, osirisda26, slalvation)

name: bluejay
text:
I simply mean that once you see behavior like this enough in real life, with unfunny, boring twists, it loses some impact.

Maybe you guys ARE all big stoners, though, and I have misjudged the popular mind again.

name: boxus
text: my vote bumped the count to 420. i got a little tingly.

name: gormster
text:
Quintessential Achewood. There is no funnier strip than this.

Oh, the irony. The hilarious dramatic irony.

name: emilyfun
text: [img src="http://photos-080.ll.facebook.com/photos-ll-sf2p/v11/139/64/6700080/n6700080_30044746_3247.jpg"]

name: sp1derbaby
text: Excellent.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Oh man, the fact that you actually did it overcomes the fact that BBcode screwed you over and that The Cure is not written in black, although yellow works kinda, Robert Smith being all hella indulgent/decadent (Woah colour symbolism).

name: darleen
text: Ray needs to hug him now.

name: xud
text: Rays expecting look in the last panel is the pay off here.

name: oishii
text: I like that Ray takes on a little bit of Roast Beef's depressive persona here.

name: dreamerman91
text: utterly absurd, yet entirely worth it

name: heavymetaljesus
text: I get exactly like this when I'm high.

name: boyd
text: You could probably replace stoned Ray in this comic with non-stoned Beef.

name: astro_zombie
text: Beef knows better than to be writing on driftwood. He'd probably whip up some Cure-related code.

name: lightupafatty
text: Some ain't need to be stoned in order to have strange cares.

name: coffeecoaster
text: I read this strip the first time while listening to the cure, and talking to myself about how much I do not like sports.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text:
Driftwood The Cure = Forgiveness
I think I've smoked enough dope in my time I don't even have to be high for this to make perfect sense.

/but I thought Teodor WAS into sports...

name: clockworkorange
text: I like to think that the telephone conversation happened entirely in Ray's mind.

name: droplede
text:
I disappointed him.
Passive-aggressive triumph, my friends.

name: buzzylinguardo
text:
not only one of the best
but it was posted on the anniversary of my birth

name: thechio
text: Yes, I know Todd.

name: charchar
text: But do you Know Todd?

name: jonnay
text: I have often thought about giving a gift of driftwood with someone's favorite band on it to them, but I would have to print off this strip and they still wouldn't get it.

name: angekfire
text: Print off the strip...on driftwood.

name: avedestron
text: This is possibly the crystallization of a perfect Achewood strip.

name: taiiga
text: Here, man. I'm sorry about all that. We cool?

name: milkpants
text: Do you know Todd? Do you really?

name: milkpants
text: oh no

name: xi
text: My first. I get ultra-paranoid when high as well and start apologizing about everything. Never in my most Pauly Shore of moments, however, would I ever think of giving the gift of driftwood - nor would I be able to reason, really, that someone didn't like sports because he listened to The Cure. Ray Smuckles does beat all.

name: c_dizzle
text: this could have ended at frame 8, am i right? but NO! no...we needed the cure driftwood. (that wasn't sarcasm. we really needed it).

name: xiaomimi
text: My favorite thing about Ray's relentless association of Teodor with The Cure is that, apart from Ray's statements to that effect, there's never been any evidence that Teodor actually likes them.

name: fosters
text: My favorite thing about this particular instance is that not only do we not know for sure if T even likes The Cure, but that since T has no idea what Ray's thought process was here he might think that the board is actually meant to be a cure for something.

name: hellofditties
text: We know that he likes The Cure now -- he has a Robert Smith poster on the ceiling about his bed.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: I am a Cure fan, I got a poster of Siouxsie and Robert in my room (though technically this would be a Banshees poster) and yet I would never ever ever put a poster of Robert Smith above my bed, that is just creepy.

name: tekende
text: I have that poster too. It is a favorite of mine. I have a pretty awesome Bauhaus poster as well.

name: st-elmos_fire
text:
It is a very nice poster, the two of them being all coy and whatnot. What is the Bauhaus poster you've got of? I seriously need a good one of them.

I just realised what a ridiculous word poster is, just looking at it seems . . . wrong

name: tekende
text: I searched google for a few minutes, but I couldn't find the one I have. It's a photo of the band in some outdoor location in London. Peter Murphy is in the forefront of the image with blonde hair and a fishnet shirt. It's pretty awesome.

name: tourach3
text: marijuana rocks

name: rowboat
text: The little corn salesman loves to smoke the weed.

name: fosters
text: THIS, on the other hand, is exactly the kind of stoner that I am.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Lyle: fffffffffffd rays

name: charchar
text: Thank you for your work and um... would you maybe consider adopting me?

name: mt85
text: Double Rays in Panel #1? Trippy.

name: lawbot
text: I actually gave a friend some driftwood once, with the name of her favourite band on it.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Had you disappointed her?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it was just to remind her of eternity.

name: dasuta
text:
The flowchart of people's likes/dislikes:

1: Do They like soccer? Yes? ->
No?
|
V
2: They like the cure.

name: explodingbat
text: "A implies B" does not imply that "not B implies not A"

name: ep2
text: In my (very, acutely , and quite) limited experience, this = true.

name: thegoodwillgirl
text:
This is my favorite strip.
Although "Ray gets sort of stoned" is excellent (of course), I feel like this strip sums up my need to give random gifts in apology for soccer miscommunications.

You'd be surprised how many of those I have.

name: poke
text:
An old boyfriend gave me a piece of bark with "The Cure" written on it for Christmas a couple years ago.


It is easily one of the most amazing things I own.

name: freagul
text: this was the strip that inspired me to finally take ten seconds to set up an account so that i could vote five on this strip

name: st_elmos_fire
text:
I am a rather extreme Cure fan, if someone gave me that as a present I would smile at them bemusedly. It would be a nice present definitely.

Also I don't dig the sports very much, probably set in just after getting heavy into the Cure.

name: atticusonline
text: it is silly to like the cure!

name: st_elmos_fire
text: Is there anything particularly wrong with being silly?

name: atticusonline
text: people stare and point at you and call you "asherdan" behind your back...it is a terrible life!

name: st-elmos_fire
text: I'd be more scared of that if there were any way to say stuff behind people's backs here, unless all of you get together in a secret meeting. Also inspection of your musical tastes leads me to believe you must be foolish.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Do The Hansa!

name: st-elmos_fire
text:
Lets wave our arms and gabble unintelligible fake German

Jeist ein heist un fooust ein fiure

name: dumase
text: In a matter of ranking things, the last strip should be a 5 and this strip should be a 5.1

name: adonkon
text: Where exactly did Ray go about procuring this driftwood?

name: jaminspoon
text: Man, he always had it.

name: un_malpaso
text: I hope they are cool now.

name: carlyle
text: Ray gets Sort of Poetic

name: mal3
text: this comic still sends me into convulsive giggles, almost 5 years after the fact.

name: rulesboy
text: He found that The Cure driftwood while Staring at the Sea.

name: jaminspoon
text:
My reaction to your comment was profound and long-lasting. I struggled with it, and myself, for nearly fifteen minutes. Like masturbating at a Jamba Juice.
In the end, I chubbied you. This was not my first instinct, but I feel that beyond the comment itself that you knew what you did and that somehow, it needed to be done and you knew and I chubbied you .
I leave it to history now. Perhaps when I am long gone, my asset shadow hereforth will remain. Children if you see this, know that I was a man and I did live and love. If I were still alive, I would chubby you all.
